title: WCAS EARTH 301-0-01 Petrology: Evolution of Crustal and Mantle Rocks

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value:
This course explores the origin, composition, and classification of igneous, metamorphic, and sedimentary rocks, application of laboratory characterization and basic thermodynamics to interpreting observed rock textures and mineral assemblages in terms of geological processes.

Prerequisite: EARTH 300 or consent of instructor.

Lab Section required.

descriptions.name: Registration Requirements
descriptions.value:
Prerequisite: EARTH 300 or consent of instructor.

Lab Section required.

descriptions.name: Learning Objectives
descriptions.value: Students will become proficient with optical microscopes, employing polarized light to identify primary and accessory minerals, and examine crystalline textures to deduce the geologic setting of rock formation.

descriptions.name: Class Materials (Required)
descriptions.value:
B.R. Frost and C.D. Frost, Essentials of Igneous and Metamorphic Petrology, 2013, Cambridge, ISBN 0174343256. //
W.S. MacKenzie and A.E. Adams, A Color Atlas of Rocks and Minerals in Thin Section, 1994, Wiley, 0470233389. //
Mead Composition Notebook, or similar Lab notebook.

descriptions.name: Class Notes
descriptions.value: Registration for one of the 2-hour lab sections on Wednesday is required.
